description:
Economically inactive population

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
12211 Microcensus

Definition:
The economically inactive population consists of people who
do not perform or search for a gainful activity, not even
marginal employment. Generally, people under the age of 15
are regarded as economically inactive.
The economically inactive population is the difference
between the total population and the economically active
population.


© Statistisches Bundesamt, Wiesbaden 2017
name: Economically inactive population
